bill_title: provide a property tax exemption to parents of certain students receiving alternative instruction.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a property tax exemption to parents of certain students receiving alternative instruction. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-36 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The parent or guardian of any student receiving alternative instruction pursuant to § 13-27-3 shall receive a partial property tax exemption if participation in any activity is denied or restricted to any student receiving alternative instruction residing within the district. The partial tax exemption shall be for the full amount under § 10-12-42. The school district shall receive a reduction in property tax revenue equal to the amount of the tax exemption received by each parent. The school district shall receive a reduction in property tax revenue for each year students receiving alternative instruction are denied participation or participation is restricted in any activity. The parent or guardian shall file for a partial tax exemption under this section on a form prescribed by the secretary of revenue. Each school district shall make the form available on the school district's website. The parent or guardian shall submit the form to the county treasurer. The treasurer shall send a copy of the submitted form to the school district finance officer. For purposes of this section the term, restricted, means a student must take one or more courses at a public school or is subject to additional requirements not applicable to students enrolled in the school district in order to qualify for participation in a school-sponsored activity. For purposes of this section, the term, activity, means any activity sponsored by the South Dakota High School Activities Association, a school district, or any school in a school district.
